results.title: Sounds of silence
results.creator_credit: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As a Victorian war veteran, Cliff Richards encapsulates his experiences during the war through the various sounds that assailed him. Sounds of helicopters, loud noises and, the one he feared the most, the sound of silence. He considers what the different sounds signify both for him and others and the way the everyday sounds of today can echo the horrors of the past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cliff Richards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Sounds Like Australia
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted film that brings you the unique sounds of the Australian bush. It interweaves the songs of our rare birds - The Victorian Rifle, Lyrebird and the Emu among others, with music that celebrates the Australian landscape and its wildlife…the sounds of Australia.

results.title: Sound waves in air
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Investigates wave characteristics of sound transmission with large-scale equipment, using frequencies up to 5000 cycles. Experiments in reflection, diffraction, interference and refraction are supplemented by ripple-tank analogies. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Sound waves
results.creator_credit: S.G. Fergusson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Shows typical examples of transverse and longitudinal wave motions to be found in nature; illustrates by diagrams the relationship between wave-length, frequency and velocity for transverse and longitudinal waves; the familiar bell-jar experiment demonstrates the necessity of a medium for the transmission of sound waves.
